title: Miles Davis - The Man With The Horn (1981)
description:
Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Man With The HornÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, recorded and released in 1981, was Miles DavisÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ first new album for six years (not counting the Water Babies, Circle In The Round and Directions compilation albums released during his layÃ¢â‚¬â€œoff). 
Miles was inspired to record again by four young musicians from Chicago: Felton Crews, Randy Hall, Robert Irving III, and his nephew Vince Wilburn Jr. A young saxophone player, Bill Evans, played on the early sessions with the Chicago musicians. Later on, Miles retained Bill Evans and brought in his old drummer Al Foster, plus a group of New York-based musicians, to complete the rest of the album.
Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Man With The HornÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is a mixed bag featuring three different bands and an eclectic mix of jazz-swing, funk, rock and disco. 


Miles Davis

The Man With The Horn

1981


  CD / 2006 / Remastered / 320Kbps


Tracklist:

1. Fat Time [March 1981]	

2. Back Seat Betty [January 1981]	

3. Shout [May 1981]	

4. Aida [March 1981]

5. The Man With the Horn [May 1981]

6. Ursula [March 1981]


Personnel:

Miles Davis: trumpet on all tracks, wah-wah trumpet on track 5

Guitar: Barry Finnerty (2, 3, 4, 6), Mike Stern (1), Randy Hall (5)

Saxophone: Bill Evans (1, 2, 3, 4, 6)

Keyboards: Robert Irving III (3, 5), Randy Hall (5)

Bass: Marcus Miller (1, 2, 4, 6), Felton Crews (3, 5)

Drums: Al Foster (1, 2, 4, 6), Vince Wilburn Jr (3, 5)

Percussion: Sammy Figueroa (1, 2, 3, 4, 6)

Vocals: Randy Hall (5)


Miles Davis / The Man With The Horn / 1981
